Address: 405 N Clarendon Ave Scottdale, GA 30079, USA
Rating: 1

You can see an exposed sewer pipe & is deep enough to do serious damage to a motorcycle or a scooter wheel. If it gets any wider, car axles will get broken.

item.title: Numerous Potholes
item.description:
Address: South Butts Road Tucson, AZ
Rating: 1

The entire length of South Butts Road has numerous potholes that have started to cause the road surface to deteriorate. The condition of the road is causing drives to weave around the potholes; not always observing pedestrians or vehicle traffic sharing the roadway. If the potholes aren’t repaired soon the entire road will need to be resurface. The safety of public visitors the Vesey Neighborhood Park, the students attending Vesey Elementary School, as well as the residents on S Butts Road are factors that should be considered to set the priority for repairing this roadway.

item.title: Left turn arrow too short for morning commuters.
item.description:
Address: Paseo Del Sol W Santa Fe, NM 87507, USA
Rating: 1

When turning left off of Paseo del Sol West onto Airport Rd. in the mornings the green arrow only lasts a few seconds causing major traffic backups on Paseo del Sol West and causing many cars to run the light. A recent fatality at this intersection, although unrelated to this particular issue, has made me very aware of the problems at this intersection.

Address: 4947-4951 N Peachtree Rd Dunwoody, GA 30338, USA

item.description:
Address: Holly St Jackson, TN
Rating: 1

Address: Delverton Drive Dunwoody Georgia 30338

Delverton Drive was damaged during 1998 tornado and Roads COmmissioner Black promised that the road would be repaved. IT has not been.

item.description:
Address: Rich'S Trailer Court Mentor OH 44060, USA
Rating: 1

Rich's Mobile Park has a trailer that has not been lived in for many years and it just sits there tilting, right on Mentor Avenue. The building beside it is just as bad! The city had the nerve to talk about the landscaping K-MART did a couple of years ago and yet let this place look like that for years.

Address: 330 Center St Meriden, CT

Garbage and cardboard boxes in front of home have been there for 3 weeks. Trash will not pick up. I believe because it is mostly cardboard boxes, they need to be put in the recycling bin for pickup. Landlord offsite.

Address: 102 Pensdale St Philadelphia, PA 19127, USA
Rating: 1

Bus with Penn State logos parked all week very close to corner of Pensdale and Main. Makes a tight squeeze for some vehicles since it's so close to corner. Also, propane tank hanging off back could get hit.

item.title: Needed: Trash Can (Park type with removable liner)
item.description:
Address: 67 Downing St. (Near Fire Hydrant)
Rating: 1

Wire trash receptacle stolen. Wanted: the kind of trash receptacle used in parks with removable liner. This area gets a great deal of pedestrian traffic with much litter. The receptacle will cut down on litter in streets and give people a place to throw cleaned-up dog poop.

item.title: Paint Bike "lane" merge - eastbound on Mt Vernon
item.description:
Address: Ashford Dunwoody Rd Ne Dunwoody, GA 30338, USA
Rating: 2

Riding eastbound on Mt Vernon crossing after Ashford-Dunwoody, the "extended curb" comes to a point at the end. This is a very dangerous point for bicyclists, as they must immediately do a lane change and merge to the right lane. Painting a "bike lane" marker with bicycle symbols and directions will indicate to drivers to allow bicyclist to merge into the right lane. This is a safety improvement.

item.title: Cut bike opening in "Porkchop" at Cherring & Tilly Mill
item.description:
Address: 4893-4899 Cherring Dr Dunwoody, GA 30338, USA
Rating: 1

For bicyclists traveling south on Tilly Mill, need to create an appx 2-3 ft wide opening in the raised cement "Porkchop" at the intersection of Cherring & Tilly Mill. This will allow bicyclists a safe passage through this intersection.

item.title: Install Streetlight
item.description:
Address: 2494 Jett Ferry Rd Dunwoody, GA 30338, USA
Rating: 1

Please install a streetlight at the intersection of Dunwoody Club Drive & Jett Ferry. There are streetlights appx 200 feet away on either side of the intersection on Jett Ferry. In the nighttime, it is very dark and dangerous for pedestrians to cross.
